However, in January 2015, he resigned as manager due to poor results and was replaced by Chris Ramsey. In April of the same year, he returned to coaching after being appointed assistant head coach under Neil Warnock at Cardiff City. He followed Warnock to Crystal Palace in August 2014 and became first team coach again when Warnock left in May 2015. Jago then joined AFC Bournemouth's staff as a scout before rejoining Queens Park Rangers in July 2016 as a club ambassador. As of March 2023, Jago is still serving in this role.
